oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Chauffeurs Ball ad
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Achieving Recognition
Professional Organizations
Balls (Parties); African Americans; Chauffeurs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An advertisement for the Colored Chauffeurs Ball, to be held at the Odd Fellows Hall in Nashville on March 22, 1909.

During segregation, African Americans formed their own clubs and professional associations. This ball was held at the Odd Fellows Hall. The Odd Fellows were a fraternal lodge, and their lodge in Nashville no longer stands.
